meanings.definition: To concentrate too much on a particular thing or aspect.
meanings.sent1: She overfocuses on her phone, forgetting to enjoy the beautiful scenery around her.
meanings.sent2: He often overfocuses on work, neglecting his health and personal relationships.
meanings.sent3: The detective overfocuses on the red herring, missing the real clue right in front of him.
meanings.sent4: Her mind overfocuses on the problem, unable to see the simple solution right there.
meanings.sent5: The artist overfocuses on every brushstroke, creating a masterpiece with meticulous detail.

meanings.definition: To give excessive attention or emphasis to something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher overfocuses on grammar, forgetting to teach other important language skills.
meanings.sent2: She overfocuses on her appearance, spending hours in front of the mirror every day.
meanings.sent3: The chef overfocuses on presentation, making the dish look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His speech overfocuses on one point, missing the opportunity to address other crucial issues.
meanings.sent5: The coach overfocuses on winning, losing sight of the importance of teamwork and sportsmanship.
